channel.title: Gage Lara's Daily Notes
channel.description: Recent content on Gage Lara's Daily Notes

item.description:
• Looking into Quickbase University and getting a Quickbase Bulder account to learn more about building Quickbase apps
    • app.brainstorminc.com/home
    • Quickbase certified App Builder
    • [[Quickbase_appbuilder_learningpath.pdf]]
    • Quickbase Junkie
    • Quickbase Getting Started Guide
  • Fix CNAME issues on GitHub pages websites

• Today I switched the theme of my blog to a more conventional blog format and plan to use the github theme for my daily blog instead
  • I also did a bit of work cleaning up what I hope to be the last of the bugs in the 2.1 version of the commoner generator
  • The daily blog is set up, but I’ll need to make some changes to auto convert the obsidian links into links to my vault website

• Very interested in Nick Milo’s linear calendar idea
    • https://youtu.be/j64YOie4bIw?si=KHj_M8a5APVmu9f1
    • https://app.anucal.com/

• Tinkered with the Shape Builder Tool and Vector Booleans (Pathfinder) in Affinity Studio Vector
    • Shape Builder is basically identical to Illustrator’s
    • Affinity’s vector booleans are almost identical to illustrator’s, though it’s missing a few Pathfinder options like Crop, Trim, Outline

• Worked a bit on [[Hexcrawl Plugin Development]]
    • Rebooting the project and getting it to a state I can publish it in
  • Did some ideation / brainstorming on [[Usurper]], which will be an extension of [[Dark Fantasy Character Playbook for MOSAIC Strict]] into a full system.
    • Derived from a lot of the experiments I did with [[Solo & Judge-less Rules for Trespasser]]

• Switched back to KDE Plasma for better Affinity experience
  • Installing Bitwig to experiment with
    • So far it seems intuitive enough, though I need to get more familiar with the core plugins available
• Yesterday did some more prompt work on [[Thousand Year Old Grimoire]]. Using my play to prompt the prompts has been surprisingly effective

• Started on two game concepts:
    • [[Many Mini Magic Manuscripts (Tiny Grimoires)]]
    • [[Thousand Year Old Grimoire]]
  • Did some physical notes / brainstorming on a usurper/adjacent game
    • Had some interesting insights on applying the [[Depthcrawl]] structure to RPG calendar / event systems

• Spent some time cleaning up [[Theurgist - Trespasser]] and sharing it to the discord, will develop it further after 2.1
  • Enjoyed a low energy day of relaxation

• Going to reestablish my old digital PKM and productivity workflows
  • Website Changes
    • Considering redoing the theme for blog.gagelara.com and using the github style theme for a daily microblog from these daily notes, possibly at daily.gagelara.com.
    • Also fixed a DNS issue with links.gagelara.com that’s been around for awhile unnoticed.
    • Going to redirect gagelara.com to a portfolio website at a later date
  • Began working on composing my notes on [[Preflighting (Print)]] and general design / print terminology to collect and demonstrate understanding.

• Made obsidian vault repo public
  • Switched DNS from Route53 to Cloudflare
  • Fixing Sops
[[OCI DevOps]]

• [[OCI Notes]] - Completed the Foundations Course and got my Certificate
  • [[OCI DevOps]]

• Sopsnix w rclone secrets
  • wire guard vpn
  • cluster config

• Going to work more on [[OCI Notes]], close to finishing the foundations course.
    • Will likely migrate Auriga to Oracle to take advantage of the always-free tier.
    • Might set up home-assistant
  • Considering making the blog more of a micro-blog and posting my thoughts far more frequently.
  • Going to rethink my project management workflow
    • Reinstalled [[Kanban Obsidian Plugin]]
    • [[User Stories]] [[Epics (PM)]] [[Initiatives (PM)]]
  • [[Trunk-Based Development (TBD)]]
  • [[DevOps]] [[Agile]]
  • [[Terraform Best Practices]]
  • A bit frustrated with OCI’s host capacity issues
• [[OCI Notes]]

• Content Research and Schedule
  • [[Helm]] [[Wallabag]]
    • Set up ingress/nodeport
      • Fixed css issues
  • [[AWS Lightsail]] for WP demo
    • Set up Site24x7 Real User Monitoring dashboard and plugin integration
      • Response time, page views, device analytics, errors, sessions
    • Upgraded php
    • WP Health Check & Troubleshooting
      • Went through all the steps to improve performance
    • Akismet Anti-spam
    • Debug bar - shows query, cache, and other helpful debugging information to the admin bar
    • Query Monitor - developer tools panel for WordPress and WooCommerce. It enables debugging of database queries, PHP errors, hooks and actions, block editor blocks, enqueued scripts and stylesheets, HTTP API calls, and more.

• Theo’s video about search and DuckDuckGo’s Bangs feature.
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_DnNzRaBWUU
    • https://soydev.link/unduck
    • https://t3.chat/
  • Made my own Bash script that launches Fuzzel in dmenu mode and runs a websearch, allowing me to accomplish this from anywhere
    • [[metamageia/post/03 - Everything, Everywhere - Fuzzel as a Universal Search Bar/index]]
  • Learned about Hugo’s Image Render Hooks and added a template for handling embedded YouTube videos from Obsidian markdown.
• GitHub launched their new certifications program
• [[OCI Notes]]

• Been too busy with family to work on much
  • Making more plans for [[My Cloud Homelab Project]]
• Made a new live [[NixOS]] USB to use with my laptop until its can be repaired

• Working on the Linux Foundation [Introduction to Kubernetes (LFS158)](Introduction to Kubernetes (LFS158) - Course Information | The Linux Foundation)
  • [[My Cloud Homelab Project]]
  • Learning about [[Talos Linux]] for [[Kubernetes (K8s)|Kubernetes]]
    • Install Talos ctl and Kube ctl
  • [[Digital Ocean]]

• Working on [[My Cloud Homelab Project]]
  • Taking some notes on cloud networking
    • [[Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR)]]
    • [[Subnet]]
    • [[Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)]] [[AWS VPC]]

• Completed [[The Cloud Resume Challenge (Notes)]]
    • Wrote and published a blog post about my experience

• Been busy with family responsibilies, but getting back to working [[My Cloud Homelab Project]] and [[The Cloud Resume Challenge (Notes)]]
  • Checking out direnv and nix-direnv for smoother development
    • https://determinate.systems/posts/nix-direnv/

• The plan today is to work more on both [[My Cloud Homelab Project]] and [[The Cloud Resume Challenge (Notes)]].
    • Homelab Goal: Deploy Jellyfin on Homelab with k3s.
    • Resume Goals: Terraform Route53, CICD Resume Front End Repo

• Gonna give a proper read to this later: https://justinas.org/nixos-in-the-cloud-step-by-step-part-1
  • Going to work refactoring the homelab today [[My Cloud Homelab Project]]
    • Got the basic Terraform + Nixos Digital Ocean workflow setup with a custom image. Looking forward to building it out. [[Terraform]]

• Took a brief detour from [[The Cloud Resume Challenge (Notes)]] to work on my new blog
    • Became a lot more familiar with [[Hugo]], DNS & custom domain setup
  • Interested in setting up a LinkTree like website too
    • Got hyper-fixated on it and ended up working on it till 1:50 am as well as setting up my subdomains
      • https://links.gagelara.com/
      • https://notes.gagelara.com/
      • https://blog.gagelara.com/
  • Going to start learning [[Terraform]]
    • Successfully ran my first couple Terraform tests, spinning up some [[AWS S3]] buckets, a Budget, and a [[AWS DynamoDB]].
    • Also integrated it into a GitOps workflow, automatically applying my Terraform configuration to AWS when pushing to GitHub
  • Interested in the [[Breadcrumbs Obsidian Plugin]]

• Was up pretty late last night figuring out my problem setting up a static site for [[The Cloud Resume Challenge (Notes)]]. Turns out the issue was an obvious oversight, as I kept forgetting to set the root object in my [[AWS CloudFront]] distribution.
    • Moved on to domain registration and setting up a [[AWS Route 53]] Hosted Zone.
  • Looking at moving my blog to a Hugo Website
• Started working on [[The Cloud Resume Challenge (Notes)]]

• [[NixOs Anywhere]] for setting up NixOS on VPS platforms
  • Making some notes on [[Git]]
    • [[FluxCD]]
  • Considering solutions for version controlling music projects, interested in making music production public and visible.
    • Also interested in setting up previews for projects on a webpage
  • Going to start plans for new homeserver setup from scratch. Need to plan out exactly what I’d like to set up on it.
    • [[K3s]]. [[Namespace (K8s)]], [[Helm]]
  • Published my CI/CD post over on the newly made Blog Metamageia

• Learning a little bit about [[Terraform]], [[Terraform-NixOS]], and [[Terranix]]
  • Going to make notes on [[Kubernetes (K8s)]] and [[STAR Format]]
    • Set up Kubernetes Homelab
  • Downloaded GitStync android
    • Decided it wasn’t quite what I wanted and switched to using the [[Git Obsidian Plugin]]
  • interested in checking out SopsWarden
  • Enjoyed Stars Without Number [[S0.5 - Establishing The Somnambulist]]

• Added a basic index.md test to my vault CICD workflow for [[metamageia/post/01 - Effortless Obsidian to Quartz CI&CD for Beginners with GitHub Actions/index]]
    • Spend most of the free time I had today working on the tutorial, with screenshots and example vaults. It’s close to being finished.

• Lost some data after my main laptop stopped working, taking this opportunity to rework my vault and start some of my configuration over with a clean slate.
    • Reinstalled the [[Obsidian Vault Changelog Plugin]] to get the [[changelog]] working again, got things properly synced via Syncthing and Github.
  • Learning about [[Github Actions]], specifically interested in automating changes to my Quartz repos.
    • Creating an automated workflow for pushing vault contents to quartz repo, building the site, and deploying.
      • Create [[Personal Access Token (PAT)]] and add it to repos
      • Set up action to checkout, remove any unwanted files, then push the source folder to the destination
      • When using the default Quartz action, sites will automatically build and deploy, allowing you to manage the content of multiple quartz sites from a single repo
    • Consider doing a write up of the process as a note. [[metamageia/post/01 - Effortless Obsidian to Quartz CI&CD for Beginners with GitHub Actions/index]]
  • Set up [[Calibre]] on the homeserver and [[Librera Reader]] on my phone, syncing the library between my devices using Syncthing for now until I decide on a permanent solution.
  • Jumped back into Duolingo, starting Spanish lessons alongside my betrothed.
  • Made the initial character note for my Stars Without Number PC [[Ivan Kurnikov]].

• Finish making notes from [[2025-06-04]]
  • After watching the video on [[Mentats]] from yesterday, I was recommended this video on memory and “how to think like a Mentat”. A bit hyperbolic, but compelling.
    • Brought up the idea of [[Interleaving]], an approach to taking break that involves naturally rotating between productive reading based on topic exhaustion.
  • Interested in trying out [[Jouve-Cerebrals Test of Induction (JCTI)]]
    • Website: https://www.cogn-iq.org/jcti-iq-inductive-reasoning-test.php
  • Also the [[Comprehensive Adult Intelligence Test (CAIT)]]
    • Website: https://cognitivemetrics.com/test/CAIT
  • 3-in-1 Memory Test
    • Website: https://practicalpie.com/free-memory-test/
  • Makes notes on [[N-Back]], [[Spaced Repetition]], and [[Rapid Serial Visual Presentation]]
  • Discussed [[Rating of Perceived Exertion]] with Terry.
  • Learning a bit about how to use [[Nix Shell]] for my [[Quartz]] project
    • Wrote what will become the Home page for the site [[index.md|The Metamageia Vault]]
  • Want to do more research into [[Polyrythms]]
    • Resources: https://www.fiveoverthree.com/, Video by Like it or Not, Video by Andrew Huang
  • Learned about the [[Nix User Repository (NUR)]]. Not sure how I missed it until today
  • Successfully set set up the quartz website: https://metamageia.github.io/The-Metamageia-Vault/

• Learned about [[Compose2nix]], a tool for converting [[Docker Compose]] configurations into a [[NixOS]] config. ([[Docker]])
  • Encountered [[NixOS Rebuild Lock Issue]] and found the fix.
  • Watched an interesting video about [[Mentats]] from [[Dune]]

• Interested in exploring [[Typst]] for markup formatting
    • https://github.com/typst/typst
    • Typst for TTRPGs: https://discourse.rpgcauldron.com/t/typst-for-ttrpgs/1640

• I set up the [[BRAT Obsidian Plugin]] so that I could install [[Nicole van der Hoeven]]’s variant of the [[Obsidian Vault Changelog Plugin]].
    • Also set up a [[changelog]] for the vault.
  • Recently set up [[ReaPack]] and [[SWS Extensions]] in [[Reaper]] so I could set up [[Reableton]] as part of my transition between DAWs.
    • I needed to install them directly into the reaper .config folder, with some guidance from this discussion on the [[NixOS]] forums.
  • Started reading [[The Phenomenology of Aesthetic Experience by Mikel Dufrenne|The Phenomenology of Aesthetic Experience]] by [[Mikel Dufrenne]]. Spent some time contemplating some of the translator’s notes in the forward regarding Dufrenne’s distinction between the Aesthetic Object and the Work of Art.
    • Watched an interesting video by John Logan on the topic.
  • Revisiting this lecture on [[Phenomenology of Agency]] by Tim Bayne
  • Exploring the possibility of contributing music & audio to [[Endless Sky]]. There’s a Discord thread discussing some of the specifics of contributing.
  • Switched to [[Fossify Calendar]] after my existing calendar app started giving me grief.
  • In a conversation with “Christopher of the Cross” on the Man Alone Discord server, I laid out a working definition of the term [[Agent]] as I make sense of it in my own metaphysical framework.
  • Added my Obsidian vault to Github, considering options for static site generation such as [[Quartz]]
